abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the project is
            to assist the government in implementing the five year
            Environmental Impact Management Agency (BAPEDAL) Development
            Plan, through: a) strengthening the institutional capacity
            and role of BAPEDAL; and b) designing and implementing
            pollution control measures at the central and regional
            levels.  To achieve these objectives, the loan will provide
            funds amounting to US$12 million equivalent to BAPEDAL to
            finance the provision of technical assistance for: i) the
            review of existing laws, regulations and procedures relating
            to pollution control; ii) design and development of
            pollution control systems and procedures; iii) planning,
            establishment, and strengthening of pollution control
            agencies and laboratories at the regional level; iv)
            assistance with recruitment processes, and the design,
            development and initiation of a training program; and v)
            external resource administration, including the preparation
            of proposals for donor financing within the framework of the
            development plan, assistance to the BAPEDAL managers for
            efficient processing and use of consultant services, and
            financial management and accounting services to meet both
            government and donor agency requirements.
